title: Sacrifices & Offerings Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Sacrifices & Offerings
description: Test your knowledge of the 96 biblical commandments related to sacrifices & offerings. Covers 50 positive and 46 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which of the following is a positive commandment regarding the valuation of consecrated property?
options: Estimate the value of consecrated animals
Do not redeem interdicted possessions
Do not offer blemished animals
Do not slaughter sacrifices outside the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: Estimate the value of consecrated animals
questions.explanation: Commandment #228 is a positive commandment requiring priests to estimate the value of consecrated animals (Leviticus 27:12).

questions.question: According to the commandments, what must be true about an animal offered as a peace offering?
options: It must be unblemished and without defect
It can have a minor blemish
It can be a castrated male
It can be offered outside the Temple courtyard
questions.correctAnswer: It must be unblemished and without defect
questions.explanation: Commandment #336 states that peace offerings must be unblemished (Leviticus 22:21), and blemished animals are not accepted (#337, #338).

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits offering sacrifices outside the Temple courtyard?
options: Do not offer any sacrifices outside the courtyard
Offer only animals which are at least eight days old
Estimate the value of consecrated fields
Bring two additional lambs as burnt offerings on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Do not offer any sacrifices outside the courtyard
questions.explanation: Commandment #372 forbids offering sacrifices outside the designated courtyard (Deuteronomy 12:13).

questions.question: The commandment to salt all sacrifices is found in which biblical book and chapter?
options: Leviticus 2
Numbers 28
Deuteronomy 23
Exodus 29
questions.correctAnswer: Leviticus 2
questions.explanation: Commandment #348 requires salting all grain offerings and is found in Leviticus 2:13.

questions.question: Which of the following is a negative commandment about the Passover lamb?
options: Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb
Eat the Passover lamb with unleavened bread and bitter herbs
Slaughter the paschal sacrifice at the specified time
Set aside the firstborn animals
questions.correctAnswer: Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb
questions.explanation: Commandment #415 forbids breaking any bones of the Passover lamb (Exodus 12:46).

questions.question: What is the required minimum age of an animal offered as a sacrifice according to the commandments?
options: At least eight days old
At least one year old
Newborn is acceptable
At least one month old
questions.correctAnswer: At least eight days old
questions.explanation: Commandment #345 requires that animals must be at least eight days old to be accepted for sacrifice (Leviticus 22:27).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids offering animals that have been castrated or have damaged testicles?
options: Do not offer to G-d any castrated male animals
Offer only unblemished animals
Bring all sacrifices from outside Israel to the Temple
Estimate the value of consecrated houses
questions.correctAnswer: Do not offer to G-d any castrated male animals
questions.explanation: Commandment #168 prohibits offering any castrated male animals or those with damaged testicles (Leviticus 22:24).

questions.question: True or False: Non-priests are allowed to eat all sacrificial meat in the Temple.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #358 forbids non-priests from eating certain sacrificial meat (Exodus 29:33).

questions.question: True or False: Honey and yeast are permitted to be burned on the altar as offerings.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #347 forbids burning honey or yeast on the altar (Leviticus 2:11).

questions.question: True or False: It is permissible to slaughter an ox or lamb in the camp instead of the Temple courtyard.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #371 forbids slaughtering sacrifices outside the Temple courtyard (Leviticus 17:3).

questions.question: True or False: The High Court must bring a sin offering if it rules erroneously.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #435 requires the High Court to bring a sin offering when it rules in error (Leviticus 4:13).

questions.question: True or False: The fat of the Passover feast may remain overnight until morning.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #406 prohibits leaving the fat of the Passover feast overnight (Exodus 23:18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The priests must eat the remains of the ______ offerings in a holy place.
options: meal
peace
sin
guilt
questions.correctAnswer: meal
questions.explanation: Commandment #366 states that priests must eat the remains of the meal offerings in a holy place (Leviticus 6:16).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: You shall offer two male lambs one year old without defect as a continual ______ offering to the LORD every day.
options: burnt
peace
sin
guilt
questions.correctAnswer: burnt
questions.explanation: Commandment #373 requires offering two male lambs daily as a continual burnt offering (Numbers 28:3).

questions.question: Which commandment requires that the ashes be removed from the altar every day?
options: Remove the ashes from the altar every day
Offer only unblemished animals
Do not offer animals bought with the wages of a harlot
Do not slaughter sacrifices outside the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: Remove the ashes from the altar every day
questions.explanation: Commandment #376 requires the priest to remove ashes daily (Leviticus 6:10).

questions.question: According to the commandments, what must be done if an animal set apart for sacrifice becomes disqualified?
options: Redeem dedicated animals which have become disqualified
Offer the animal anyway
Sell the animal to a non-Israelite
Use it for work
questions.correctAnswer: Redeem dedicated animals which have become disqualified
questions.explanation: Commandment #344 prescribes redeeming dedicated animals that become disqualified (Deuteronomy 12:15).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids offering animals purchased with the wages of a harlot or a dog?
options: Do not offer animals bought with the wages of a harlot or the wages of a dog
Offer only unblemished animals
Do not offer any sacrifices outside the courtyard
Bring all sacrifices in the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: Do not offer animals bought with the wages of a harlot or the wages of a dog
questions.explanation: Commandment #346 forbids such offerings (Deuteronomy 23:18).

questions.question: Which positive commandment relates to bringing offerings on the Feast of Trumpets?
options: Bring additional offerings on the Feast of Trumpets
Offer only animals which are at least eight days old
Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb
Do not eat sacrifices past their allowed time
questions.correctAnswer: Bring additional offerings on the Feast of Trumpets
questions.explanation: Commandment #388 prescribes offerings on the Feast of Trumpets (Numbers 29:1).

questions.question: Which commandment requires that the priests eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple only?
options: The priests must eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple
Do not eat the meat of the inner sin offering
Offer only unblemished animals
Do not offer blemished animals
questions.correctAnswer: The priests must eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple
questions.explanation: Commandment #356 states priests must eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple (Exodus 29:33).

questions.question: What does commandment #440 forbid regarding consecrated animals?
options: Do not substitute another beast for one set apart for sacrifice
Offer two lambs for sacrifice every day
Bring all sacrifices from outside Israel to the Temple
Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb
questions.correctAnswer: Do not substitute another beast for one set apart for sacrifice
questions.explanation: Commandment #440 forbids substituting or exchanging consecrated animals (Leviticus 27:10).

questions.question: Which commandment states that the ashes to which the fire reduces the burnt offering must be taken up daily?
options: Remove the ashes from the altar every day
Burn the leftover sacrifices
Salt all sacrifices
Do not eat sacrifices which have become unfit
questions.correctAnswer: Remove the ashes from the altar every day
questions.explanation: Commandment #376 directs the priest to remove ashes daily (Leviticus 6:10).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids offering an animal with wounds or defects, even if offered by foreigners?
options: Do not sacrifice blemished animals even if offered by those who are not part of the Covenant
Offer only animals which are at least eight days old
Estimate the value of consecrated houses
Bring additional offerings on the Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: Do not sacrifice blemished animals even if offered by those who are not part of the Covenant
questions.explanation: Commandment #342 forbids accepting blemished animals even from foreigners (Leviticus 22:25).
